docs.snippet: A welcome was extended to visiting Latin-American chiefs of staff and their military aides yesterday by Major Gen. Hugh A. Drum, commanding the First Army, who served as host at a luncheon at the Ambassador Hotel. The delegation arrived from Detroit...
docs.lead_paragraph: A welcome was extended to visiting Latin-American chiefs of staff and their military aides yesterday by Major Gen. Hugh A. Drum, commanding the First Army, who served as host at a luncheon at the Ambassador Hotel. The delegation arrived from Detroit by special plane at noon.

headline.main: GEN. DRUM GREETS LATIN DELEGATION; Military Leaders, on a Tour of Nation, Are Welcomed at Luncheon After Arrival THEY VISIT THE FAIR LATER General Says That Trip Gives There Evidence of Growing Ties in Hemisphere

docs.snippet: Six days of weakening prices were halted yesterday in the share list, and, despite the uncertainties overhanging the international situation and the extended week-end due to the holiday today, prices registered gains which averaged a point. Final...
docs.lead_paragraph: Six days of weakening prices were halted yesterday in the share list, and, despite the uncertainties overhanging the international situation and the extended week-end due to the holiday today, prices registered gains which averaged a point. Final values were slightly under the best of the session as a result of mild ...

headline.main: FINANCIAL MARKETS; Gains in Stock Market Average a Point as Trades Increase--Halt Called to Six Days of Weak Markets

docs.snippet: THE loan of $4,600,000 by the Export-Import Bank to the government of Costa Rica, recently announced, will fi  nance completion of one of the five remaining gaps in the Pan American Highway.
